name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: This weekâ€™s early warning dashboard shows that all 67 counties have substantial COVID transmission.  For the next three weeks, Iâ€™m asking Pennsylvanians to stand united against COVID.  Together we can turn the tide of this surge and save lives. But we have to do it together.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: The bipartisan COVID relief bill under consideration right now does not include everything that our people need,  But it is a vital first step.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Our federal government needs to make it easier â€” not harder â€” for people to follow COVID safety precautions.  We need more assistance for our frontline workers, small businesses, and schools â€” as well as funding to support a swift and successful vaccine distribution program.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: This morning I joined @GovMurphy in @ProtectOurCareâ€™s Coronavirus War Room to urge Congress to pass a COVID relief package.  Itâ€™s disgraceful that during the worst surge of #COVID19, federal leaders seem incapable of providing Americans with desperately needed aid and support.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Individual actions make all the difference when it comes to slowing the spread of #COVID19.  I know itâ€™s not easy to completely change your life for so long, but some choices are much safer than others right now â€” especially with COVID cases at a historic high.  https://t.co/79peVNP3ic

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Now in effect through January 4, 2021: New temporary mitigation measures to target high-risk environments and slow the spread of the COVID.   Together we can protect our hospital system, health care workers, and each other as we get closer to a vaccine.  https://t.co/NbDCTwDvPo

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Even with safety measures in place, COVID makes indoor dining dangerous.  Itâ€™s not the fault of restaurant and bar owners or their employees.  These businesses need and deserve help to weather the pandemic.  Itâ€™s time for federal leaders to step up and pass the Restaurants Act.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: On Thursday evening, I received my second negative COVID test. It appears my positive test on Tuesday came at the end of the course of the virus.  I'll continue to quarantine and carry out my duties from home, following @CDCgov and @PAHealthDept guidelines for asymptomatic cases.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: According to the CDC, approximately half of new COVID infections are transmitted by people with no symptoms.   Wearing a mask keeps you and those around you safe.  https://t.co/3VX02a9ebX

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Yesterday I announced additional, temporary COVID mitigation measures for Pennsylvania.  The new restrictions begin Saturday and will be in effect until 8 a.m. January 4. Learn more about the new measures here â¤µï¸  https://t.co/58QHZfGNdP

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: We must unite to keep our hospitals and health care workers from becoming overwhelmed, and help Pennsylvanians get through the holiday season â€” and closer to a COVID vaccine â€” as safely as possible.  Together we can flatten the curve.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: COVID thrives where people gather together.  The measures announced today will target high-risk environments and aim to slow the devastating spread of the virus.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: It has become clear that we need to take further action to protect Pennsylvanians and stop the spread of COVID.  Today Iâ€™m announcing additional, temporary mitigation measures that will go into effect Saturday and remain in place until 8 a.m. on January 4.  https://t.co/QyO4GgkWUD

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Happy to share Frances has tested negative for COVID.  Thank you for the well-wishes and support we have received.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Pennsylvaniaâ€™s health care professionals are working tirelessly to save lives during the COVID-19 pandemic.    The best thing we can do to thank them is take steps to help slow the spread and lift some of the burden off their shoulders.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: As this virus rages, my positive test is a reminder that no one is immune from COVID.  Following all precautions as I have done is not a guarantee, but it is what we know to be vital to stopping the spread of the disease.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: During a routine test yesterday, I tested positive for COVID-19.  I have no symptoms and am feeling well and I am in isolation at home.  I am following CDC and Department of Health guidelines. Frances has been tested and, as we await the result, is quarantining at home with me.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Our health care workers put their lives on the line to take care of Pennsylvanians.  All they ask in return is that we take COVID seriously and follow simple precautions â€” stay home as much as possible, wear masks, and practice good health habits.    https://t.co/ABrckLf31k

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Hospitalizations are reaching critical levels in Pennsylvania because of COVID.  Overwhelmed hospitals would be dangerous for everyone â€” people who need care for COVID and for any other medical emergency.  https://t.co/qVlmytM9P3

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Doctors and nurses are frightened. And they're asking the public for help to stop the spread of COVID.  We can't continue to take our medical workers for granted.  They've been doing everything in their power to protect us from COVID.  And we need to do the same for them.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Overwhelmed hospitals are dangerous for everyone â€” those who need care for COVID and for any other emergency.  It becomes increasingly likely that resources and staff will be stretched to the breaking point with every day that COVID continues to spread in Pennsylvania.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: If you didnâ€™t know before how urgent the situation is, please pay attention now.  The number of COVID cases in Pennsylvania over the course of the entire pandemic has topped 400,000.  Just six weeks ago that number was 200,000.  Hospitals are crowded and resources are dwindling.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Today Iâ€™m with @PAHealthDept to sound the alarm that COVID cases in Pennsylvania have reached critical levels.  If we donâ€™t slow the spread of this dangerous virus now, the reality is that COVID-19 will overwhelm our hospitals and our health care workers.  https://t.co/cDrYV5gjcX

name: Governor Tom Wolf
